meanings.definition: A group of filamentous bacteria that form branching filaments resembling fungi.
meanings.sent1: Actinomycetes are bacteria that look like tiny branches.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study actinomycetes to learn more about their structure.
meanings.sent3: The actinomycetes at the party were the life of the microscopic gathering.
meanings.sent4: In the world of bacteria, actinomycetes stand out like intricate trees in a forest.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, actinomycetes appear as delicate, branching organisms.

meanings.definition: Any bacterium of the order Actinomycetales, including many that are pathogenic to humans and animals.
meanings.sent1: Actinomycetes can cause infections in both humans and animals.
meanings.sent2: Doctors need to be aware of the potential dangers of actinomycetes.
meanings.sent3: The actinomycetes in the lab plotted to take over the petri dish.
meanings.sent4: Like silent invaders, actinomycetes can quietly harm their hosts.
meanings.sent5: The presence of actinomycetes can be a hidden threat lurking in the environment.
